The Israeli military stated the strikes were a response to Hamas attacking its troops, a claim Hamas denies. The renewed violence strains the ceasefire amid disputes over the return of hostage remains.

title: U.S. kills 14 in strikes on alleged Pacific drug boats
description: In three strikes carried out Monday (October 27, 2025) in international waters, 14 “narco-terrorists” were killed and one survived, U.S. Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth said, making it the deadliest day of the U.S. campaign so far

title: 'It's time to move forward' - PSL team owner calls for truce with PCB
description: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen has extended an olive branch to the PCB, proposing four reforms for better PSL management after a public dispute. Tareen, who previously tore up a legal notice from the board, now seeks a "fresh relationship" built on transparency and trust. This move follows a heated exchange over critical remarks about PSL governance.

title: Smoke over Rio de Janeiro: Anti-gang raid leaves 64 dead, including four cops — video
description: A massive police operation targeting the Comando Vermelho gang in Rio de Janeiro resulted in at least 64 deaths, including four officers, marking the deadliest raid in the city's history. The operation, involving 2,500 security personnel, occurred days before Rio hosts major global climate events.

Concerns about transparency and age bias have surfaced, with players questioning their exclusion despite strong domestic performances. Memories of the mid-1960s rice shortage in Tamil Nadu
description: The Hindu, in a news report on October 7, 1964, stated that “Thanjavur district, the ‘rice bowl’ of the Madras State [which was how the State was called then], has been experiencing very great difficulty for the last six weeks in meeting the local demands for rice and daily one can see long queues in every town and village in the district waiting for hours to get their daily quota.”

title: Shreyas Iyer update: Near-fatal injury to ICU exit — how the Sydney scare unfolded
description: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is stable after a serious on-field injury in Sydney, which caused internal bleeding and required ICU care. Doctors successfully arrested the bleeding through a medical procedure, and Iyer is now recovering well, out of the ICU, and eating normally. His recovery is progressing faster than anticipated.

description: Mohammad Rizwan has refused to sign Pakistan's new central contract after being demoted to Category B. He is reportedly seeking the reinstatement of Category A for senior players and clearer tenures for captains. Rizwan's concerns stem from his recent removal as ODI captain.

title: When over 50 people perished in a bizarre fire accident on the Madras-Bangalore Highway

title: Cyclone Montha: Andhra, Odisha battered; 1 dead, thousands evacuated
description: Cyclone Montha made landfall on India's eastern coast, bringing fierce winds and heavy rain to Andhra Pradesh and Odisha. The severe storm caused damage, including snapped power lines and flooded homes, with one fatality reported in Andhra Pradesh. Authorities initiated extensive evacuations and deployed rescue teams to aid affected populations.

Rich in Vitamin C, amla offers superior immunity, heart health, and metabolic benefits at a fraction of the cost. This ancient fruit, deeply rooted in Ayurveda, provides unparalleled nutritional value and sustainability, making it a wise choice for modern wellness.

The internet is obsessed with Herbert's 'I'm not here for this' expression, which perfectly captures his low-key persona amidst Hollywood's glitz. This calm demeanor, a stark contrast to celebrity drama, is proving to be his unexpected superpower.

title: Another blow to Maoists: 2 more top leaders surrender in Telangana; DGP credits CM Reddy
description: Two prominent CPI (Maoist) leaders, central committee member Pulluri Prasad Rao alias Chandranna and Telangana state committee member Bandi Prakash alias Prabhath, have joined the mainstream. Citing deteriorating health, ideological divisions, and security pressure, they surrendered without arms, receiving rehabilitation packages. Chandranna, however, rejected the term 'surrender' and vowed to continue advocating for Maoist ideology among the people.

title: SC backs landlord even when tenant’s son didn’t sign rent receipts
description: The Supreme Court ruled in favour of a Bengaluru landlord in a tenant eviction case. The apex court held that rent receipts signed by the landlord are sufficient proof of a landlord-tenant relationship under the Karnataka Rent Act, 1999, even if the tenant's son denied signing them.

Deal with 'foreign country' to strike Afghan: Pak's big confession at Turkey talks
description: Pakistan has reportedly admitted to an agreement with an unnamed "foreign country" permitting drone strikes on Afghan soil during TTP assaults. This revelation emerged as Pakistan sought to withdraw from Turkey talks, insisting on its right to conduct such attacks. The Afghan delegation countered that the TTP issue is Pakistan's internal problem.

title: UN report finds countries’ emission reductions short of goal set in Paris
description: To keep temperatures below 2°C and 1.5°C, countries must cut emissions 37% and 57% respectively of 2019 levels by 2035

How Elon's Grokipedia holds up against Wikipedia
description: Behind the hype lies an ambition larger than just rewriting the internet’s encyclopaedia: Musk wants to challenge who gets to define truth. Grokipedia, built by Musk’s xAI team and powered by its Grok large language model, is positioned as a “less biased” alternative to the “venerable” Wikipedia. Of course, in Musk-world, “less biased” translates loosely to “more aligned with Elon’s worldview.” Not that Wikipedia isn’t biased — and in particular topics, is left of Fidel Castro.

description: India is bringing its gold reserves home. The Reserve Bank of India has moved significant amounts of gold back to domestic vaults. This repatriation follows global events that highlighted risks of holding sovereign assets abroad.

title: Toronto Maple Leafs line changes: Sammy Blais set for season debut vs Flames
description: Injuries have paved the way for Sammy Blais' season debut with the Toronto Maple Leafs against the Calgary Flames. Reunited with coach Craig Berube, Blais aims to inject physicality and speed into the lineup.  Berube highlighted Blais' forechecking prowess and puck skills, anticipating he'll make opponents uncomfortable.  This move signals Toronto's search for consistency early in the season.

Officials warned of catastrophic damage, with at least seven deaths reported across the Caribbean. Mandatory evacuations and pre-positioned aid are underway as the island braces for devastation.

Ryan Kesler misconduct case: Wife Andrea Kesler stands by ex-NHL star amid scandal
description: Former NHL center Ryan Kesler faces two counts of fourth-degree criminal sexual conduct in Michigan following a January 1 incident. Police investigated for nearly 10 months before filing charges against the 41-year-old, who pleaded not guilty and was released on bond. His wife, Andrea Kesler, is reportedly standing by him amid the legal scrutiny.

title: ‘Watch your tone’: Bihar SHO suspended after CCTV footage shows him confronting brother, sister at eatery
Kunchako Boban joins forces with Shahi Kabir for another thriller: ‘Teaming up with the man of the moment’
Bihar polls: Govt jobs, Waqf Act, toddy - key takeaways from MGB's 'Tejashwi Prann'
description: The RJD-Congress-led Mahagathbandhan has unveiled its manifesto, "Bihar ka Tejashwi Prann," for the upcoming Bihar elections, promising significant changes. Key pledges include one government job per family within 20 days of forming the government, restoration of the Old Pension Scheme, and Rs 2,500 monthly for women under the Mai-Behin Maan Yojana, alongside 200 units of free electricity.

title: High blood sugar damages your feet: Causes, symptoms and prevention tips
description: Diabetic foot, a serious yet preventable complication, arises from prolonged high blood sugar damaging nerves and blood flow. This leads to vulnerable feet, infections, and ulcers that can result in amputation if untreated. Early recognition of symptoms like non-healing wounds and daily foot checks are crucial for prevention and management.

title: What China fears most: Not Trump - but who after Xi Jinping?
ChatGPT Go subscription now free: Offer starts November 4; Who are eligible users
description: OpenAI is making its ChatGPT Go subscription free for all Indian users for a year, starting November 4. This strategic move targets India, the company's second-largest and fastest-growing market, in response to aggressive user acquisition by rivals Google and Perplexity.

title: 30,000 layoffs at Amazon: Managers receive email; HR division faces deepest cuts
description: Amazon initiated urgent manager training on October 27, preceding notifications to up to 30,000 corporate employees about layoffs starting the next day. These cuts, impacting nearly 10% of its corporate workforce across various divisions, represent the company's largest job reduction. The move comes amid aggressive cost-cutting and significant AI investments, with a strict return-to-office policy failing to reduce staff voluntarily.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in fire-red at Chiefs MNF, steals Patrick’s spotlight
description: Brittany Mahomes is making a significant impact this NFL season, both with her bold fashion choices and her community involvement.  She recently wowed fans with a striking fire-red leather outfit, showcasing her growing influence beyond her husband Patrick's football career.  Together, the couple continues to give back to Kansas City through their foundation and sports team ownership.

title: Ex-SC State Player Robert Geathers Wins $18M Lawsuit Against NCAA
description: A South Carolina jury awarded $18 million to former South Carolina State player Robert Geathers and his wife, finding the NCAA negligent for failing to warn players about the long-term risks of concussions. Geathers, diagnosed with dementia and showing symptoms of CTE, played from 1977-1980. Attorneys argued the NCAA withheld crucial information about concussion dangers.
